meanings.definition: To subject (someone or something) to something again.
meanings.sent1: The teacher resubjected the students to the same test to see if they had improved.
meanings.sent2: She resubjected her essay to another round of edits before submitting it.
meanings.sent3: The cat resubjected the poor mouse to another round of chasing, much to the mouse's dismay.
meanings.sent4: The storm resubjected the fragile roof to its relentless fury, causing it to leak even more.
meanings.sent5: The doctor resubjected the patient to the painful procedure in order to monitor their progress.

meanings.definition: To cause (someone or something) to undergo a particular experience or form of treatment again.
meanings.sent1: The therapist resubjected the patient to the traumatic memory to help them process it.
meanings.sent2: He resubjected his plants to the same watering schedule after noticing they were wilting.
meanings.sent3: The prankster resubjected his friend to the same practical joke, much to everyone's amusement.
meanings.sent4: Life resubjected her to the same heartbreak, but this time she faced it with more resilience.
meanings.sent5: The chef resubjected the dish to the same seasoning, resulting in a burst of flavor.
